messages.title: Neighbourhood Watch
messages.content: Martin is involved with Neighbourhood Watch in Leeds and Harrogate - helping local people 'feel safer' and reducing crime.

messages.title: Working in the community
messages.content: Martin became involved as a parent governor at Oatlands School which led Martin to stand for election at the Prince Henry's School.

messages.title: A Great Day Out for all the family
messages.content: Martin Eglese helped organize the Oatlands Pre-School Community Gala Fun Day, a family event open to all.

messages.title: Stroke campaign update
messages.content: Martin Eglese has worked with the Stroke Association and personally with stroke victims.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Address the parking issues near both Oatlands and Pannal Schools which are compromising the safety of children.
Local residents are questioning the effectiveness of the 20mph speed limits in Pannal.

mentions.candidate: Martin Eglese is mentioned as involved in various community and safety efforts in Pannal and a parent governor.
mentions.tacticalSituation: It's a two-horse race between the Liberal Democrats and the Conservatives here.

issues.education: Martin Eglese became involved as a parent governor at Oatlands School leading to his standing for election at the Prince Henry's School.
issues.environment: Martin Eglese is involved in the local community as a volunteer, enhancing the neighbourhood.
issues.health: Martin Eglese has worked with the Stroke Association and personally with stroke victims.

politicalExperience.achievements: Involved as a parent governor at schools, involved with Neighbourhood Watch in Leeds and Harrogate, helped organize a local gala fun day, worked with the Stroke Association and stroke victims.

quotes.text: It's SO close in Harrogate & Knaresborough...
It's either the Lib Dems or the Conservatives here...

images.caption: Claire Kelley and Martin Eglese campaigning for REAL change
